content.protection: 13 BOLTS & CHAINS 60 METER ROPE ONLY WATCH END OF ROPE WHEN LOWERING
8 more bolts & chains.  22 draws if you do it in 1 pitch.  70 meter rope only or 2 raps
content.location: 2nd pitch to fire water or hot pockets goat land wall
east of goat land wall 40 feet or so.  2nd pitch to culture shock
3RD CLIMB FROM RIGHT SIDE OF WALL

climbs.name: Hellboy
climbs.fa: Jimmy F, Greg M, Darren Edmunds, Brian Goody - 10/03/2012

content.description:
This is a 4-bolt extension of Highway to Hell which adds a thin technical crux to the 9+ climbing below.

Clip the anchor of HtH long or skip it in favor of a bolt a few feet higher then tackle a dihedral on excellent gray rock, milking small crimps and sidepulls to span what looks like a blank section. Once established above the dihedral a devious bulge guards the way to the anchors. A whale of a time can be expected on the last few moves.
content.protection: 13 draws to chains shared with Dissorder. The upper bulge feels a bit airy with the last bolt well below your feet, you can clip the last bolt of Dissorder on the left but it pulls you away from the best holds
content.location: Start on Highway to Hell and continue past the anchors up a dihedral for 4 more clips.

content.description: constant climbing to a committing crux
content.location: to the right of hot pockets left of highway to hell
40 feet east of goat land wall.  1st pitch to subhumans.  2 raps required

climbs.name: The Battle Continues
climbs.fa: Greg Martinez, Brian Goody, Dereck Sander - 10/22/2012

content.description:
Very different in style from the rest of the Goatland routes, TBC tackles a clean panel of very soft white rock littered with square-ish black holds. It starts less than vertical but the angle kicks back quickly and the holds get further apart, leading to a very airy bulge right below the anchors. The climbing is pretty straightforward but the pump builds up when pulling the weight of 35m of rope while clipping from crimps.

One of the best pitches up there.
content.protection:
6 draws plus whatever you need for the pitches below. A total of 21 or 22 to link with Agent Orange (21 if skipping the intermediate anchor). A couple of long runners on the 2 leftmost bolts of AO keep the rope in a perfect straight line.

Rappel/lower of chain anchor, it's a FULL 70m with nothing to spare to get back to the ground.
content.location: Second pitch to Agent Orange (directly in line) or Hellfire (a bit more to the side).

climbs.name: Agent Orange
climbs.fa: Greg Martinez, Zack G, Laura Dewey 6/22/2012

content.description:
A long, adventurous sport line up the characteristic and tasteful

Hellgate

limestone. Like the chemical

Agent Orange

, this line is a mixture of two equal parts, solid rock and not. A decent and direct line up various terrain, don't be fooled, this climb is not to be missed if in the area.

Agent Orange

climbs and stays inside the obvious corner. Climb past ~13 bolts to a two bolt chain anchor. Stop here and lower or continue past the anchor to

The Battle Continues

.Â Shares the first two bolts with

Hell Fire

.
content.protection: Fifteen quickdraws for thirteen bolts plus a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Left of the arete inside the corner of Hell Fire.
